org.ireas.mediawiki

Class MediaWikiFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ireas.mediawiki.MediaWikiFactory

  • public final class MediaWikiFactory
extends Object
    Factory for MediaWiki instances. The factory provides easy access to wikis installed according to the WMF installation scheme (newWikimediaInstance) and to Wikipedia language versions (newWikipediaInstance). Per default, HTTPS is used. newInstance connects to a custom MediaWiki installation.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfiguration

        public static MediaWikiConfiguration getConfiguration()
        Returns the current configuration for the created MediaWiki instances.
        Returns:
        the current MediaWiki configuration

      • newInstance

        public static MediaWiki newInstance(String scheme,
                    String host,
                    int port,
                    String apiPath)
                             throws MediaWikiException
        Constructs a new MediaWiki instance using the specified connection credentials. The specified credentials are the parts of the URI pointing to the MediaWiki api.php file to access.
        Parameters:
        scheme - the scheme of the URI, e. g. "https"
        host - the host of the URI, e. g. "example.org"
        port - the port of the URI, e. g. 443. The port must be non-negative.
        apiPath - the path of the URI, e. g. "/index.html"
        Returns:
        a new MediaWiki instance pointing to the MediaWiki installation located at the specified URI
        Throws:
        MediaWikiException - if the specified URI parts are invalid
        NullPointerException - of the specified scheme, host or api path is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified port is negative

      • newWikimediaInstance

        public static MediaWiki newWikimediaInstance(String host)
                                      throws MediaWikiException
        Constructs a new MediaWiki instance using the api.php located on the specified host according to the WMF scheme. That means that the api.php file must be located at "/w/api.php". The constructed MediaWiki uses HTTPS on port 443.
        Parameters:
        host - the host of the MediaWiki installation to connect to
        Returns:
        a new MediaWiki instance pointing to the MediaWiki installation on the specified host
        Throws:
        MediaWikiException - if the specified host is invalid
        NullPointerException - if the specified host is null

      • newWikipediaInstance

        public static MediaWiki newWikipediaInstance(String language)
                                      throws MediaWikiException
        Constructs a new MediaWiki instance for the specified Wikipedia language version. The specified language must be the WMF language code (the subdomain, e. g. "de" for German). The constructed MediaWiki instance will use HTTPS.
        Parameters:
        language - the language code of the Wikipedia version to connect to
        Returns:
        a new MediaWiki instance for the specified Wikipedia language version
        Throws:
        MediaWikiException - if the specified language is invalid
        NullPointerException - if the specified language is null

      • setConfiguration

        public static void setConfiguration(MediaWikiConfiguration configuration)
        Sets the configuration used for new MediaWiki instances created using this factory class. A change does not affect previously created instances.
        Parameters:
        configuration - the configuration for new MediaWiki instances
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified configuration is null
